 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 25 August 2025 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/79/L.116/Rev.1)] 
 
 
 79/324. Extraordinary Chambers in the Courts of Cambodia – 
residual functions 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Recalling its resolutions 75/257 В of 7 July 2021 and 77/299 of 26 June 2023, 
 
Recalling also that the expenses of the Extraordinary Chambers in the Courts of 
Cambodia shall be defrayed in accordance with the relevant provisions of the 
Agreement between the United Nations and the Royal Government of Cambodia 
concerning the Prosecution under Cambodian Law of Crimes Committed during the 
Period of Democratic Kampuchea (the Agreement) 1 and that the expenses to be 
defrayed by the United Nations in accordance with those provisions shall be borne by 
voluntary contributions from the international community, in accordance with 
resolution 57/228 В of 13 May 2003, 
 
Welcoming the efforts of the Secretary-General and the Royal Government of 
Cambodia towards completion of the work of the Extraordinary Chambers, including 
with regard to the drawdown of activities and the residual functions requiring 
performance, 
 
Welcoming also the report of the Secretary-General,2 and taking note of the 
determination by the United Nations and the Royal Government of Cambodia that the 
Extraordinary Chambers will continue to implement residual functions for an 
additional period of two years, from 1 January 2026 to 31 December 2027, 
 
Welcoming further the intention of the Royal Government of Cambodia to 
establish a permanent public independent institution to, among other tasks, serve as a 
research centre, as well as the principal repository for the public to access information

on the Cambodian accountability process, and encouraging the Royal Government of 
Cambodia to take steps in that respect, 
 
1. 
Encourages the Secretary-General and the Royal Government of 
Cambodia to take all the measures necessary to fully implement the Addendum to the 
Agreement between the United Nations and the Royal Government of Cambodia 
concerning the Prosecution under Cambodian Law of Crimes Committed during the 
Period of Democratic Kampuchea on the Transitional Arrangements and the 
Completion of Work of the Extraordinary Chambers (the Addendum) 3 with a view to 
working towards the completion of the remaining residual functions and ensuring an 
orderly and timely transition to the new Cambodian institution; 
 
2. 
Requests the Secretary-General to undertake with the Royal Government 
of Cambodia similar consultations, as envisaged under article 2, paragraph 2, of the 
Addendum, with respect to the period beyond 2027 or, in the event of the earlier 
completion of the judicial functions during the additional period from 1 January 2026 
to 31 December 2027, to assess whether there is any need for the remaining residual 
functions to be performed by the Extraordinary Chambers; 
 
3. 
Also requests the Secretary-General to report to the General Assembly at 
its eighty-first session on the implementation of the present resolution. 
 
88th plenary meeting 
25 August 2025

paragraphs.1: Encourages the Secretary-General and the Royal Government of Cambodia to take all the measures necessary to fully implement the Addendum to the Agreement between the United Nations and the Royal Government of Cambodia concerning the Prosecution under Cambodian Law of Crimes Committed during the Period of Democratic Kampuchea on the Transitional Arrangements and the Completion of Work of the Extraordinary Chambers (the Addendum) 3 with a view to working towards the completion of the remaining residual functions and ensuring an orderly and timely transition to the new Cambodian institution;
paragraphs.2: Requests the Secretary-General to undertake with the Royal Government of Cambodia similar consultations, as envisaged under article 2, paragraph 2, of the Addendum, with respect to the period beyond 2027 or, in the event of the earlier completion of the judicial functions during the additional period from 1 January 2026 to 31 December 2027, to assess whether there is any need for the remaining residual functions to be performed by the Extraordinary Chambers;
paragraphs.3: Also requests the Secretary-General to report to the General Assembly at its eighty-first session on the implementation of the present resolution.
